column4: I jsut installed the 32bit version of ubuntu server. I didn't know it came with a gui?
also on my 32bit server install, its only seeing 3 gigs of my 3 gigs of ram.
so can I upgrade my 32bit install to be 64bit?
i couldn't get the 64bit iso to boot via usb stick
more likely you'll need clean install
yeah, sure I'd upgrade this machine, but i got ram when it was > $150 per 1gig stick :)
still sux that I couldn't boot from 64bit iso
sure, but I either have to go buy a dvd ide drive, dvd usb drive, or find out why the 64bit server image wont boot
but i had to use that alternative cd - because of the fake raid0
well , i've newer loaded the server version, so can't tell
server install should support PAE and see all ram
its weird because I have 4096 gigs, i would think thats still under the limit
i think that real limit is ~3.3gb , its all to do with marketing , etc .. lol
